title: Since TP had it's cooldown increased can it have the 3.5 second channel time back?
body:
It is still a really long cooldown so if you are going to use it why not be able to actually show up potentially before everything is finished.

It isn't likely to out class Ignite currently but if it could be used to gank bot lane when the enemy team is over extended more reliably it might have more reason to be used.

When Riot tried to give Assassin's items to themselves, so that they might be able to balance them easier (?), not to purposefully make an Assassin meta. 
> 
> They make changes that change the meta, but they do not plan to make a certain meta. That is the difference being made.

Sry to sound so blunt, but you REALLY are naive if you think Rito doesn't intentionally change the meta. Do you really think they have NO understanding of their game whatsoever? Do you think it is a coincidence that all their changes in the last few years just so happened to lead to shorter and shorter games? A good example of an actual unintended meta shift was when, few patches ago, they buffed baron and it was actually slightly DIFFICULT to take without a whole team. But they fixed that little mistake in the very next patch didn't they?

Change the meta? Yes. They do, but not directly. It happens when something prevalent is strong, they nerf it, and then something else takes over. Example: ADC prevalence, when Crit was nerfed, Lethality ADCs became a thing because the playerbase found it more effective. Did Riot's nerfs cause a change to the Meta? Yes. Did they look at the game, think "We want a Lethality Meta" and then nerf crit expecting that to happen? No. That came out of left field. 

The playerbase is largely responsible for the actual meta, because they innovate and figure out what can become viable. What can become meta, is largely responsible on Riot's changes, from nerfs and buffs. If something is too strong, it'll get nerfed, and then something new will come out as the newest strongest thing, and then that will be nerfed. 

Riot can affect the meta, but they do not look at the game, and say "Yes, we want *this* meta." Game state/length is not the same as Meta, but it can help affect the meta.

No they started taking simply for tower security. Teleport has never been broken because it has always had a long CD before the 1 min nerf it was at 5 minutes and for top laners it presented a risk to use as a ganking tool. Sure you can use it as a ganking tool but when you do you give up lane pressure and if nothing comes of you using teleport to gank then you would probably start losing gold and maybe even your tower because top laners have to back and try walk and to their tower in an already long lane. The Teleport nerf did nothing but negatively affect top laners. It lessened the ability to save their tower by teleporting rather than trying to walk back to it in a long lane. It also lessened top laners influence on the map which is already low because top is the most isolated lane on the map.Bot lane hasn't changed at all from teleport the nerf but top lane has. So good luck asking top laners to Teleport gank now because we basically run ignite as the primary summoner now since the nerf made teleport even more risky to use.
